title: How to Make Bacon Wrapped Hot Dogs

steps.headline: Lay out a slice of bacon on a silicon or wooden cutting board.
Place the hot dog on the bacon at one end.
steps.description: Roll the bacon and hot dog around and around until the bacon covers the whole hot dog. Set aside.

steps.headline: Repeat with the remaining hot dogs.
steps.description: You might need to use toothpicks to hold the bacon in place––judge this as you roll.

steps.headline: Heat the heavy-based skillet over low heat.
steps.description: Add the butter or oil (use sparingly, as the bacon will make more fat as it cooks). Be mindful of spattering grease.

steps.headline: Add the bacon-wrapped hot dogs.
steps.description: Sprinkle with a little brown sugar, if desired.

steps.headline: Fry.
steps.description: Turn over midway, when the bottom side has browned and the bacon has begun to get crisp. Fry until the bacon looks cooked. Note: You might need to drain some of the grease from the skillet at this point.

steps.headline: Remove skillet from the heat.
steps.description: Carefully lift out the cooked hot dogs with tongs or a spatula. Place on paper towelling to drain excess grease.

steps.headline: Serve with coleslaw, cheese, mustard, relish or whatever other condiments you enjoy with hotdogs.
